wrap_sssm.detection.detection#

Sleep Semantic Segmentation: fast and robust detection of ‘Spindle’, ‘Background’, ‘Arousal’,’K-complex’, ‘Slow wave’, ‘Vertex Sharp’, ‘Sawtooth’ from one channel sleep EEG recordings. - Author: Xiaoyu Bao - GitHub: - License:

Classes#

SleepEventDetect

Functions#

sleep_event_detect(data[, sf, wave_name, device, ...])

Detects sleep events in the provided data.

Module Contents#

wrap_sssm.detection.detection.sleep_event_detect(data, sf=None, wave_name=['Spindle', 'Background', 'Arousal', 'K-complex', 'Slow wave', 'Vertex Sharp', 'Sawtooth'], device='cuda', model_name='model.pt', model_path=None, step=50, event_threshold={'Spindle': 0.95, 'Background': 0.9, 'Arousal': 0.9, 'K-complex': 0.6, 'Slow wave': 0.6, 'Vertex Sharp': 0.6, 'Sawtooth': 0.6}, overall_threshold=0.5, verbose=False)[source]#

Detects sleep events in the provided data.

Parameters:

  • data (array-like) – Input data for sleep event detection.

  • sf (float, optional) – Sampling frequency. Defaults to None.

  • wave_name (list, optional) – List of wave names. Defaults to [‘Spindle’, ‘Background’, ‘Arousal’, ‘K-complex’, ‘Slow wave’, ‘Vertex Sharp’, ‘Sawtooth’].

  • device (str, optional) – Device to run the model on. Defaults to ‘cuda’.

  • model_name (str, optional) – Name of the model file. Defaults to ‘model.pt’.

  • model_path (str, optional) – Path to the model file. Defaults to None.

  • step (int, optional) – Step size for detection. Defaults to 50.

  • event_threshold (dict, optional) – Thresholds for each event. Defaults to {‘Spindle’: 0.95, ‘Background’: 0.9, ‘Arousal’: 0.9, ‘K-complex’: 0.6, ‘Slow wave’: 0.6, ‘Vertex Sharp’: 0.6, ‘Sawtooth’: 0.6}.

  • overall_threshold (float, optional) – Overall detection threshold. Defaults to 0.5.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Verbose output. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The detected sleep events.

Return type:

results

class wrap_sssm.detection.detection.SleepEventDetect(model, wave_name, data, sf, thresh, step, overall_threshold)[source]#
summary(event=None)[source]#

Provides a summary of detected events.

Parameters:

event (str, optional) – The specific event name to summarize. Defaults to None.

Returns:

If event is None, returns a dictionary with event details for all wave_names.

If event is provided, returns the details for the specified event.

Return type:

dict or pd.DataFrame

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified event is not in the wave names.

_get_event_df(wave_names)[source]#

Filters the event dataframe by wave names.

Parameters:

wave_names (list) – List of wave names to filter by.

Returns:

Filtered event dataframe for wave_names.

Return type:

DataFrame

plot_average(event_type=None, figsize=(6, 4.5), **kwargs)[source]#

Plots the average waveform of specified event types.

Parameters:

  • event_type (list, optional) – List of event types to plot. Defaults to None.

  • figsize (tuple, optional) – Figure size for the subplot. Defaults to (6, 4.5).

Returns:

Axes of the average sleep event plot.

Return type:

list

Generates a mask for every event type.

Returns:

Mask dictionary for every event type.

Return type:

dict

_plot_events(ax, event_type, cmap, norm, xrng=None)[source]#

Plots the detected events on the given axis.

Parameters:

  • ax (Axes) – Matplotlib axis to plot on.

  • event_type (list) – List of event types to plot.

  • cmap – Colormap to use for plotting.

  • norm – Normalization for colormap.

  • xrng (range, optional) – X-axis range for plotting. Defaults to None.

plot_detection(event_type=None, figsize=(12, 4), cmap='Spectral')[source]#

Plots the detection of specified event types.

Parameters:

  • event_type (list, optional) – List of event types to plot. Defaults to None.

  • figsize (tuple, optional) – Figure size for the plot. Defaults to (12, 4).

  • cmap (str, optional) – Colormap for plotting. Defaults to ‘Spectral’.

Returns:

Interactive plot object.

Return type:

interactive

calculate_feature(event_type=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Calculates features for the specified event types.

Parameters:

event_type (list, optional) – List of event types to calculate features for. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Calculated features for each event type.

Return type:

dict

calculate_feature_spindle(**kwargs)[source]#

Calculate features of sleep spindles from EEG data.

Parameters:

  • freq_sp (tuple) – Frequency range for spindle detection (default: (12, 15)).

  • freq_broad (tuple) – Broad frequency range for filtering (default: (1, 30)).

Returns:

DataFrame containing spindle features including Peak, Duration,

Amplitude, RMS, AbsPower, RelPower, Frequency, Oscillations, and Symmetry.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Notes

This function is based on the original implementation provided by raphaelvallat/yasa

calculate_feature_slow_wave(**kwargs)[source]#

Calculate features of slow waves from EEG data.

Parameters:

  • freq_sw (tuple) – Frequency range for slow wave detection (default: (0.3, 1.5)).

  • amp_neg (tuple) – Amplitude range for negative peaks (default: (40, 200)).

  • amp_pos (tuple) – Amplitude range for positive peaks (default: (10, 150)).

Returns:

DataFrame containing slow wave features including NegPeak,

MidCrossing, PosPeak, ValNegPeak, ValPosPeak, PTP, Slope, and Frequency.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Notes

This function is based on the original implementation provided by raphaelvallat/yasa

calculate_feature_other(i_event_type)[source]#

Retrieve features of other specified event types from EEG data.

Parameters:

i_event_type (str) – The event type for which features are to be retrieved.

Returns:

DataFrame containing features of the specified event type.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
